text_to_speech: um so congratulations for winning the gold medal the first question is how do you feel about winning the gold medal in the sea game it's great you know the fans here were great the energy was great it just felt it's amazing it's experience you know many people don't experience this so it's just a great feeling so how about you [Music] uh it was great man happy to be here in the country and win for the country and get them a gold medal and uh you know just happy for the fans they've been through a lot so happy to see them happy no this is my first time it's a lifetime the experience was great you know I was able to visit a country I've never been to before and to play in the theater three on three was even amazing yeah yeah yeah first time also uh hopefully it won't be the last and you know we still got some more work to do with the 505 so we're gonna see how this thing go keep this thing rolling how long have you been training prepare for this weekend about three or four weeks you know as soon as I got the call for it I was training for it right away yeah so have you expect to win the gold medal in a second yeah definitely you got to come in in this type of events and have confidence you know with our confidence there's no win because this key confidence is definitely key in every game so do you have any let's say two Cambodia plan for the fans thank you for everything thank you for allowing us in your country and you know we got a lot more work to do and uh all right we're gonna try to pull out again another gold medal with the five on five and we love the fans so thank you so much

timecoded_text_to_speech.text: So congratulations for winning the gold medal.
The first question is how do you feel about winning the gold medal in the sea game?
It's great. The fans here were great. The energy was great. It's amazing.
It's a experience. Many people don't experience this, so it's just a great feeling.
How about you? How do you feel after winning the gold medal?
It was great, man. Happy to be here in the country and win for the country and get them
gold medal and just happy for the fans. They've been through a lot, so happy to see them happy.
So the conclusion is, have you previously played for the everybody in the sea game?
No, this is my first time, so life. The experience was great. I was able to visit the country
I never been to before and the play in the 3-on-3 was even amazing.
You are the first time.
Yeah, yeah, yeah. First time also, hopefully it won't be the last.
We still got some more work to do with the 5-on-5, so we don't see how they staying go. Keep the staying road.
How long have you been training prepared for the sea game?
About three or four weeks. Some like out the call for it. I was training for it right away.
Yeah, so most of you have been training for, take your form and you are.
So, have you expected to win the gold medal in the sea game?
Yeah, definitely. You've got to come in and it's about events and have confidence.
But our confidence, there's no win because this key confidence is definitely key in every game.
So, do you have any message to can go to your fans?
What is it? Your message for the fans.
Thank you for everything. Thank you for allowing us to your country.
We got a lot more work to do and we're going to try to pull out again.
Another gold medal with the 5-on-5 and we love the fans.
Thank you so much.

youtube_description:
SEA Games: Cambodian basketball player PRIDGETT Sayeedalkabir is overjoyed by the tremendous support he has received from fans and hopes that this is not the first or last time he will represent Cambodia. 

He has had the confidence to win the gold for Cambodia since before the event started.
 
“Confidence is the key to winning gold medals,” said PRIDGETT Sayeedalkabir, the gold medalist.

Video by Te Chhaysinh

#Cambodianess #Cambodia2023 #SEAGames2023
